qas.question: In what year was the Church of Scotland recognized as a Presbyterian institution by the moncarh?
Which group was formed when ministries seceded from The Church of Scotland in 1733?
What year were most Presbyterians in Scotland reunited?
Which two groups were involved in the reuniting of Scotland's Presbyterian churches?

answers.text: Church of Scotland and the United Free Church of Scotland

qas.question: During which year was the England Revolution?
The Acts of Church was signed in which year?
Which group formed in 1707 after ministers seceded from the Church of Scotland?

context: However, with the <b4_0>Glorious Revolution<b4_0/> of <a0_0><b5_0>1688<b5_0/><a0_0/> the Church of Scotland was finally unequivocally recognised as a Presbyterian institution by the monarch due to Scottish Presbyterian support for the aforementioned revolution and the <b6_0>Acts of Union<b6_0/> <b7_0>1707<b7_0/> between Scotland and England guaranteed the Church of Scotland's form of government. However, legislation by the United Kingdom parliament allowing patronage led to splits in the Church. In 1733, a group of ministers seceded from the Church of Scotland to form the <a1_0><b8_0>Associate Presbytery<b8_0/><a1_0/>, another group seceded in 1761 to form the Relief Church and the Disruption of 1843 led to the formation of the Free Church of Scotland. Further splits took place, especially over theological issues, but most Presbyterians in Scotland were reunited by <a2_0>1929<a2_0/> union of the established <a3_0>Church of Scotland and the United Free Church of Scotland<a3_0/>.
